# Security Policy for CESAFI Sports Website

The CESAFI Website Team takes the security of the CESAFI Sports Website seriously. We appreciate your efforts to responsibly disclose any vulnerabilities you may discover.

## üîí Supported Versions

We currently only provide security updates for the **latest stable release** of the CESAFI Sports Website. We encourage all users to always keep their deployments updated to the most recent version.

## Reporting a Vulnerability

If you discover a security vulnerability within the CESAFI Sports Website, please report it to us as soon as possible via our private security reporting channel. **Please do NOT open a public GitHub issue or discuss it in public forums (like Discord) as this could expose the vulnerability to malicious actors.**

### How to Report

Please send an email to the project lead at:

[porternicolo@gmail.com](mailto:porternicolo@gmail.com)

**In your report, please include as much detail as possible to help us understand and reproduce the issue:**

- **Vulnerability Type:** What kind of vulnerability is it? (e.g., XSS, SQL Injection, broken authentication, sensitive data exposure, misconfiguration)
- **Description:** A clear and concise description of the vulnerability.
- **Steps to Reproduce:** Detailed steps to reliably reproduce the vulnerability. This is crucial for us to verify and fix the issue quickly.
  1.  [Step 1]
  2.  [Step 2]
  3.  [And so on...]
- **Impact:** What is the potential impact or consequence of this vulnerability? (e.g., unauthorized access to data, data corruption, denial of service)
- **Affected Components:** Which parts of the application are affected? (e.g., login page, API endpoint `/api/games`, specific database table)
- **Environment Details (if applicable):**
  - Browser and version (e.g., Chrome 120, Firefox 118)
  - Operating System (e.g., Windows 11, macOS Sonoma, Android 13)
  - Any specific network conditions or configurations.
- **Screenshots or Video:** If possible, include screenshots or a short video demonstrating the vulnerability.

### üõ°Ô∏è Our Commitment

Upon receiving a security report, we commit to the following:

- We will acknowledge receipt of your report within **2 business days**.
- We will investigate the reported vulnerability promptly.
- We will keep you informed of our progress, including when a fix has been deployed.
- We will credit you for your responsible disclosure if you wish, after the vulnerability has been patched and publicly disclosed (if deemed necessary).

Thank you for helping us keep the CESAFI Sports Hub secure for everyone!

_This policy is inspired by common open-source project security guidelines._
